                    <guid isPermaLink="false">93f05ebe-aec9-425a-ad75-c0c91eb016ef</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/the-long-range-drone-that-can-keep-up-with-a-car-and-fly-for-an-hour/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>The long-range drone that can keep up with a car and fly for an hour</title>
<description>A German team are aiming to build a faster drone that can keep going for longer by adding combustion engines.</description>
<pubDate>Wed, 27 May 2015 14:31:00 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Nick Heath</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
                            <item>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">398155aa-1d3d-4623-84f9-e6ef4a483b27</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/five-silver-linings-of-the-public-cloud/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>Five silver linings of the public cloud</title>
<description>Customers of Amazon Web Services reveal the rewards of migrating key systems to the public cloud platform.</description>
<pubDate>Fri, 17 Apr 2015 08:11:58 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Nick Heath</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
                            <item>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">ab6b7da8-9d5c-47a4-a01d-47c2c80f7611</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/why-studying-computer-science-may-not-be-the-best-choice-for-infosec-professionals/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>Why studying computer science may not be the best choice for infosec professionals</title>
<description>Business and liberal arts majors are starting to win information security jobs away from computer science graduates as the changing nature of the job requires softer skills - according to one of the world's largest trainers of infosec professionals.</description>
<pubDate>Thu, 16 Apr 2015 00:01:00 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Nick Heath</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
                            <item>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">f397350d-d80e-4083-9fd4-f4853c761f50</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/how-3d-printing-could-make-robotic-hands-more-affordable/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>How 3D printing could make robotic hands more affordable</title>
<description>The start-up that wants to make customised, robotic hands available to the millions of people with missing hands worldwide.</description>
<pubDate>Mon, 30 Mar 2015 11:42:00 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Nick Heath</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
                            <item>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">3a7e994a-5760-4553-af4c-09aef9ad6e08</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/how-to-scale-online-services-for-millions-of-users-without-losing-vital-data/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>How to scale online services for millions of users without losing vital data</title>
<description>European gambling portal bet365 on how the programming language Erlang and the NoSQL data store Riak is helping it handle millions of transactions at once.</description>
<pubDate>Wed, 25 Mar 2015 11:07:00 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Nick Heath</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
                            <item>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">056058fd-6d84-423d-9d04-3a3901c22197</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/forget-the-smartphone-hype-pcs-are-still-the-most-important-business-gadget/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>Forget the smartphone hype, PCs are still the most important business gadget</title>
<description>Smartphones might create gadget envy, but it seems that nothing beats a PC for real work.</description>
<pubDate>Wed, 18 Mar 2015 13:01:40 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Steve Ranger</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
                            <item>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">d3cc1e60-a317-435c-9576-b0d75cb3d005</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/the-machines-that-defined-british-computing-from-the-spectrum-bbc-micro-and-amstrad-to-the-flan/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>The machines that defined British computing: From the Spectrum, BBC Micro and Amstrad to...the Flan</title>
<description>As the Raspberry Pi edges closer to becoming the best-selling British computer of all time we take a look at the classic machines to come out of the UK.</description>
<pubDate>Thu, 26 Feb 2015 11:23:00 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Nick Heath</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
                            <item>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">6a37c100-f1a6-43c9-a4c6-ffa46c029b77</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/uk-poised-to-relax-rules-on-employing-overseas-workers-for-some-it-jobs/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>UK poised to relax rules on employing overseas workers for some IT jobs</title>
<description>The UK government is recommended to allow start-ups to employ workers from outside Europe in developer and cyber security roles without trying to fill those roles domestically.</description>
<pubDate>Wed, 25 Feb 2015 15:00:44 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Nick Heath</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
                            <item>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">3a404fee-468f-43b5-9176-521afe592ad1</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/bigger-budgets-better-tech-why-2015-is-a-good-year-to-be-working-in-it/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>Bigger budgets, better tech: Why 2015 is a good year to be working in IT</title>
<description>CIOs are feeling optimistic about their prospects and budgets are on the up.</description>
<pubDate>Wed, 04 Feb 2015 13:38:00 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Steve Ranger</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
                            <item>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">aa10d8ba-dc5f-4fba-a20c-dbb0a3aa0112</guid>
<link>https://www.techrepublic.com/article/raspberry-pi-2-launch-six-times-faster-with-support-for-windows-10-and-ubuntu/#ftag=RSS56d97e7</link>
<title>Raspberry Pi 2 launch: Six times faster with Windows 10 and Ubuntu support</title>
<description>A major update to the credit card sized Raspberry Pi board is introduced, with a boost to the CPU and memory expected to help it run as a general-purpose PC.</description>
<pubDate>Mon, 02 Feb 2015 13:14:00 +0000</pubDate>
<media:credit role="author">Nick Heath</media:credit><s:doctype>Text</s:doctype></item>
